meanings.definition: A dog trained to hunt or retrieve birds.
meanings.sent1: My uncle's birddog fetched the duck he shot.
meanings.sent2: The birddog ran swiftly through the field, tracking the pheasant.
meanings.sent3: The birddog wagged its tail happily after finding the hidden quail.
meanings.sent4: She was a birddog on the hunt for any feathered prey.
meanings.sent5: The birddog's keen sense of smell led it to the fallen goose.

meanings.definition: To seek out or follow closely, as if hunting like a bird dog.
meanings.sent1: I will birddog the suspect until we catch him.
meanings.sent2: The detective decided to birddog the criminal's movements.
meanings.sent3: He likes to birddog his friends when they play hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: The journalist will birddog the story until she gets all the facts.
meanings.sent5: The cat tried to birddog the mouse, but it escaped into its hole.

meanings.definition: A person who seeks out potential customers or clients for a business.
meanings.sent1: As a birddog for the company, he brought in many new clients.
meanings.sent2: The birddog was successful in finding leads for the sales team.
meanings.sent3: The birddog convinced the hesitant customer to try the new product.
meanings.sent4: She was the best birddog in the team, always closing deals.
meanings.sent5: The birddog's persuasive skills helped the business grow rapidly.
